Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Philadelphia register card records findspot as 'house of jeweller'; cf. Petrie 1886, p. 65. Weight: 16.48 g. = EEF distribution list Philadelphia no. 27. This would indicate the silversmith's hoard, but this is a later piece, none of which were found in a secure context; it is highly unlikely that the specific 'house of jeweller' reached Philadelphia from the field.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (UA.010)
